page.title: 19Local Legend.
page.content: The'Degradation of Drunkenness'is on the wall of the original vicarage.It was put there by a vicar in the late 19th century to warn his parishioners. 'There is no sin which doth more deface Gods image than drunkenness it disguiseth a person and doth even unman him.Drunkenness makes him have the throat of a fish,the belly of a swine and the head of an ass. Drunkenness is the shame of nature, the extinguisher of reason,the shipwreck of chastity and the murderer of conscience.Drunkenness is hurtful to the body,the cup kills more than the cannon,it causes dropsies, catarrhs,apoplexies it fills the eye with fire,and the legs with water and turns the body into a hospital'.
